text_blocks.snippet: Free and low-cost, sliding-scale counselling in North Vancouver is available through Family Services of the North Shore (6 weeks free, 604-988-5281), the Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) North and West Vancouver (low-cost, 1-888-261-7228), and Foundry North Shore (free for youth 12-24, 604-984-5060). These services offer in-person, phone, or virtual support for various mental health needs.
Free & Low-Cost Counseling Options North Vancouver:

list.snippet: Family Services of the North Shore: Offers up to 6 free sessions for COVID-19 related stress, as well as affordable, sliding-scale ($30-$125/session) counseling for individuals, couples, and families.
CMHA North and West Vancouver: Provides short-term, low-cost, confidential, one-to-one counseling for adults (19+).
Foundry North Shore: Free drop-in mental health counseling for youth aged 12-24.
Peer Assisted Care Team (PACT): A community-led response for mental health and well-being, available by calling 1-888-261-7228 (8 am - 12:30 am, 7 days a week).
REACH Medical Clinic: Provides free virtual counseling sessions covered by MSP.
Parkgate Community Services Society: Offers community-based counseling services.
Crisis Line: 310-6789 (no area code needed) for 24/7 mental health support.
Call 8-1-1 or 2-1-1: For information on local free or low-cost counseling services.
Hope for Wellness: 1-855-242-3310 or hopeforwellness.ca for immediate, culturally competent, and confidential counseling.

text_blocks.snippet: For specialized support, such as for children and youth, you can also consider resources like YouthLAB, which offers mental health initiatives for young people.
